dict.string: Art created by an autonomous system (often a computer program). It can be random or completely deterministic and imperative.
An interactive book, that runs on the Swift Playgrounds app and enables you to write and run Swift code within it.
A form of artistic expression that explores the aesthetics of data corruption in digital or analog environments.
Often regarded to be the tiniest element of an image or display, for which is attributed a color. Contraction of **Pic**ture **el**ement.

A programming statement that describe a loop that executes the block of code it contains, until its condition is satisfied. A for loop that iterates an entire array will only stop when it iterates the last element.
A data structure that consists of a collection of elements with the same type of data. Accessed by index, often starting from 0.
A symbol that share design features within a set (font). It can represent a letter, number or any other special character.
Pieces that include or simulate hand-drawn letters. It dates back to the works of the people that hand copied books before printers. Usually features highly decorated and stylized letters.
Set of instructions to perform a specific task. Which can be called whenever that task needs to be performed. Usually created to isolated code that is used multiple times.
A form of artistical expression that uses the characters and symbols of the **A**merican **S**tandard **C**ode for **I**nformation **I**nterchange (ASCII) to create graphical pieces.
